snippet.title: Angular for Beginners Course [Full Front End Tutorial with TypeScript]
snippet.description:
Learn Angular in this complete course for beginners. First you will learn the basics of Typescript and then you will learn about important Angular concepts such as binding, dependency injection, forms, routing, and more. 

‚úèÔ∏è Santosh Yadav created this course. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/TechTalksWithSantosh
üîó https://twitter.com/SantoshYadavDev
üîó https://github.com/sponsors/santoshyadavdev

üíª API Code: https://github.com/santoshyadavdev/hotelapi

‚≠êÔ∏è Course Contents ‚≠êÔ∏è
Introduction
‚å®Ô∏è (0:00:00) Introduction to Angular
‚å®Ô∏è (0:09:56) Introduction to Typescript
‚å®Ô∏è (0:28:57) SPA and Local Setup
Typescript
‚å®Ô∏è (0:42:09) Typescript Data Types and Functions
‚å®Ô∏è (1:25:56) Classes and Interface
‚å®Ô∏è (2:11:10) Typescript decorators and tsconfig file
Angular Installation and Basics
‚å®Ô∏è (2:20:24) Angular Installation and Binding Syntax
‚å®Ô∏è (3:25:04) Built-in Directives
‚å®Ô∏è (4:07:36) Built-in Pipes
‚å®Ô∏è (4:30:10) Adding Bootstrap CSS to App
Lifecycle Hook and Component Communication
‚å®Ô∏è (4:44:53) ngOnInt and Component Communication using Input and Output
‚å®Ô∏è (5:09:32) Change Detection and ngOnChanges
‚å®Ô∏è (5:36:51) ngDoCheck
‚å®Ô∏è (5:42:01) ViewChild, ViewChildren and AfterViewInit
‚å®Ô∏è (6:22:41) Content Projection, AfterContentInit and OnDestroy
Dependency Injection
‚å®Ô∏è (6:44:55) Introduction
‚å®Ô∏è (7:09:34) Resolution Modifiers
‚å®Ô∏è (7:24:06) Value Providers
HttpClient and RxJs
‚å®Ô∏è (7:41:04) Setting Up HttpClientModule
‚å®Ô∏è (7:44:07) HttpService , RxJs observables and http get
‚å®Ô∏è (8:01:28) RxJs Observable and Observer
‚å®Ô∏è (8:11:59) Http Put and Delete
‚å®Ô∏è (8:27:10) Http Request
‚å®Ô∏è (8:40:55) ShareReplay RxJs Operators
‚å®Ô∏è (8:47:17) Async Pipe
‚å®Ô∏è (8:57:15) catchError operator
‚å®Ô∏è (9:05:29) map operator
‚å®Ô∏è (9:09:06) Http Interceptor
‚å®Ô∏è (9:29:11) APP_INITIALIZER
Routing Basics
‚å®Ô∏è (9:35:06) Angular Router and default Route
‚å®Ô∏è (9:51:01) Adding Angular material and navigation
‚å®Ô∏è (10:00:35) Wild card, dynamic route and ActivatedRoute service
‚å®Ô∏è (10:23:19) ParamMap and Activate Route Service
Template Driven Forms
‚å®Ô∏è (10:25:45) Introduction
‚å®Ô∏è (10:50:20) Validation
‚å®Ô∏è (11:09:26) Pristine, Dirty State and Reset Form
‚å®Ô∏è (11:19:08) Custom Directives and Custom Validation
Advanced Routing
‚å®Ô∏è (11:49:33) Navigation using Router Service
‚å®Ô∏è (11:52:34) Feature and Routing Module
‚å®Ô∏è (12:10:57) Nested and Child Route
‚å®Ô∏è (12:19:41) Lazy Loading
‚å®Ô∏è (12:35:49) Configure Lazy Loading using CLI
‚å®Ô∏è (12:42:46) Using ProvidedIn Any
‚å®Ô∏è (12:59:15) Router Events
‚å®Ô∏è (13:06:00) Listening to Router Events
Route Guards
‚å®Ô∏è (13:08:49) CanActivate
‚å®Ô∏è (13:21:24) CanActivateChild
‚å®Ô∏è (13:26:53) CanLoad
Reactive Forms
‚å®Ô∏è (13:30:44) Introduction
‚å®Ô∏è (13:41:33) Using Material Controls
‚å®Ô∏è (13:59:54) Nested Form Controls
‚å®Ô∏è (14:17:38) Dynamic Forms
‚å®Ô∏è (14:45:09) Built-in Validators
‚å®Ô∏è (14:51:50) Reset Form
‚å®Ô∏è (14:55:15) Control Level Validation
‚å®Ô∏è (15:05:22) SetValue and PatchValue
‚å®Ô∏è (15:09:23) ValueChanges and UpdateOn
‚å®Ô∏è (15:17:40) map operator with Form
‚å®Ô∏è (15:29:55) Custom Validator
CanDeactivate Guard
‚å®Ô∏è (15:57:10) CanDeactivate Guard and Form
Custom Pipe
‚å®Ô∏è (16:15:04) Custom Pipe
Resolve Guard
‚å®Ô∏è (16:25:39) Resolve Guard
Global Error Handling
‚å®Ô∏è (16:45:46) Error Handling
Testing Basics
‚å®Ô∏è (16:50:08) Introduction
‚å®Ô∏è (16:56:59) First test
‚å®Ô∏è (17:01:43) Testing Component and Service
Deployment and CI/CD
‚å®Ô∏è (17:15:44) Using Netlify for Deployment
‚å®Ô∏è (17:28:06) GitHub Actions to Automate Tasks

snippet.title: Learn Angular A-Z: Complete Tutorial for Beginners
snippet.description:
It's not an exaggeration to say Angular changed the way we build web applications. Learn the A to Z of Angular in this comprehensive four-hour video course. ‚ñ∫ Download unlimited photos, fonts, and templates with Envato Elements: https://elements.envato.com/?utm_campaign=yt_tutsplus_JWhRMyyF7nc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=youtube.com&utm_content=description

Angular is a larger framework than React or Vue, providing more features and built-in capabilities out of the box. But that makes it a bit more difficult to get started.

In this course, you‚Äôll learn everything you need to get started writing applications with Angular. We‚Äôll start at the very beginning: you‚Äôll install the Angular command-line tools, and we‚Äôll create a new project together.

You‚Äôll learn how to display data with Angular‚Äôs directives and templating syntax, as well as binding data to properties, attributes, and handling events. We‚Äôll then dive into components, and you‚Äôll learn how to create components that accept input and provide output. You‚Äôll also learn how to set up two-way binding and manipulate styles within your components.

Later, we‚Äôll look at some of the services and concepts that Angular uses, such as dependency injection, modules, and observables. You‚Äôll learn how to create and use modules to organize your application, handle and validate form input with reactive forms, and build single-page applications with Angular‚Äôs router. Here's the course structure:

1. Introduction
00:00:00 1.1 Introduction
2. Getting Started
00:01:52 2.1 Installing and Using the Angular CLI
00:15:22 2.2 Creating a Data Model
00:22:46 2.3 Iterating Arrays
00:30:13 2.4 Making Decisions
00:41:46 2.5 Binding Data to Properties and Attributes
00:47:54 2.6 Binding Events
00:54:58 2.7 Using ngModel to Bind Values to Form Controls
01:05:02 2.8 Listening for Changes to ngModel Values
01:12:43 2.9 Using Getters to Filter and Provide Data
3. Creating Custom Components
01:18:14 3.1 Creating a Component With Input
01:27:24 3.2 Outputing Information From a Component
01:33:17 3.3 Initializing Component Functionality
01:41:02 3.4 Setting Up Two-Way Binding
01:48:33 3.5 Practicing Two-Way Binding
01:55:30 3.6 Styling Components
4. Using Angular's Services
02:01:29 4.1 Using Observables to Create an Event Bus
02:15:30 4.2 Refactoring the WishListItem Component
02:19:24 4.3 Injecting Dependencies
02:26:17 4.4 Issuing HTTP Requests
02:36:05 4.5 Providing Options for HTTP Requests
02:43:30 4.6 Handling Errors for HTTP Requests
5. Using Modules
02:51:42 5.1 Creating Modules
03:01:19 5.2 Exporting Single Components
6. Working With Reactive Forms
03:06:02 6.1 Introducing Reactive Forms
03:14:39 6.2 Creating Control Groups
03:20:02 6.3 Validating Reactive Forms
03:33:05 6.4 Writing Custom Validators
7. Using Angular's Router
03:42:31 7.1 Defining Routes
03:50:49 7.2 Handling "Not Found" Pages
03:56:19 7.3 Navigating to Routes
04:03:28 7.4 Providing Data to Routes
04:10:17 7.5 Using Route Parameters
8. Conclusion
04:20:05 8.1 Conclusion

Useful Links:
‚Ä¢¬†Course Source Files: https://github.com/jwmcpeak/Angular-Fundamentals
‚Ä¢¬†Angular: https://angular.io/
‚Ä¢¬†Node.js: https://nodejs.org/
‚Ä¢¬†Visual Studio Code: https://code.visualstudio.com/

We have a lot to cover, so let‚Äôs get started!

localized.title: Learn Angular A-Z: Complete Tutorial for Beginners
localized.description:
It's not an exaggeration to say Angular changed the way we build web applications. Learn the A to Z of Angular in this comprehensive four-hour video course. ‚ñ∫ Download unlimited photos, fonts, and templates with Envato Elements: https://elements.envato.com/?utm_campaign=yt_tutsplus_JWhRMyyF7nc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=youtube.com&utm_content=description

Angular is a larger framework than React or Vue, providing more features and built-in capabilities out of the box. But that makes it a bit more difficult to get started.

In this course, you‚Äôll learn everything you need to get started writing applications with Angular. We‚Äôll start at the very beginning: you‚Äôll install the Angular command-line tools, and we‚Äôll create a new project together.

You‚Äôll learn how to display data with Angular‚Äôs directives and templating syntax, as well as binding data to properties, attributes, and handling events. We‚Äôll then dive into components, and you‚Äôll learn how to create components that accept input and provide output. You‚Äôll also learn how to set up two-way binding and manipulate styles within your components.

Later, we‚Äôll look at some of the services and concepts that Angular uses, such as dependency injection, modules, and observables. You‚Äôll learn how to create and use modules to organize your application, handle and validate form input with reactive forms, and build single-page applications with Angular‚Äôs router. Here's the course structure:

snippet.title: Introducing... the NEW Angular framework
snippet.description:
My new Angular course: https://angularstart.com/ 

The Angular team have been hinting and teasing at an upcoming announcement for Angular, and it's finally here!

We already have a ton of new features like signals and standalone components, with many more to come including signal based components with massive improvements to change detection. To match this new age of Angular, the team have re-branded with a new site, new docs, and a fancy new logo!

More on the state management approach: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R4Ff2bPiWh4

8:16 Is Angular "back"?
